channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Russian opposition leader seen groaning on flight after suspected poisoning
item.description: Russian opposition leader and Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny was hospitalized Thursday morning after what his spokeswoman Kira Yarmish said was poisoning.

item.title: Obama issues a dire warning about American democracy in stunning rebuke of Trump
Recap night three of the Democratic Convention in under 2 minutes
item.description: President Barack Obama made a passionate appeal, singer Billie Eilish got political, and Hillary Clinton warned voters about the mistakes of 2016.

item.title: Kamala Harris defines her role on historic night
Watch full speeches from night 3 of the Democratic National Convention
Many leaders used Covid as cover to dent democracy. Trump may be the first to openly admit it
item.description: In the months since Covid-19 swept the globe, leaders the world over have been accused of exploiting the pandemic for political gain while laying waste to democratic norms. Few, if any, have gone as far as to reveal those plans publicly.

item.title: Controversy over Australian PM's vaccine comments points to the next coronavirus nightmare
Here's what happened when students went to school during the 1918 pandemic
750 million genetically engineered mosquitoes approved for release in Florida Keys
item.description: A plan to release millions of genetically modified mosquitoes in 2021 has won final approval from authorities in the Florida Keys, despite the objection of many local residents and a coalition of environmental advocacy groups.

item.title: How one hotel helped unleash Australia's new outbreak
item.description: More than 90% of new Covid-19 cases in Australia's state of Victoria can be traced back to one quarantine hotel, officials say. The state has launched a judicial inquiry into what went wrong in the quarantine hotels that helped unleash a fresh outbreak in the state. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: US suspends extradition treaty with Hong Kong due to concerns over city's eroding autonomy
item.description: The United States government has officially suspended its extradition treaty with Hong Kong over concerns that the Chinese government's new national security law is eroding the city's autonomy.

item.title: Broadcaster leaves MLB game broadcast after uttering anti-gay slur on air
item.description: A broadcaster who was heard uttering a homophobic slur on an MLB game broadcast left the booth during the contest Wednesday.

item.title: The White House has stopped even pretending Trump won't contest the election results
While Obama gave his DNC speech, Trump sent hate tweets
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo and Jeremy Diamond fact check President Trump's tweets that were posted as former President Barack Obama gave his speech at the 2020 Democratic National Convention.

item.title: California wildfires: 23 major blazes stretching state's firefighting resources
item.description: Northern California resident Gus Valerian woke up to pounding on the door of his Vacaville home.

item.title: The US Senate just dropped a massive Russia bombshell (and most people missed it)
item.description: On Tuesday, the Senate Intelligence Committee dropped a bombshell about Russia's interference in the 2016 election -- and its ongoing efforts to disrupt the 2020 contest as well.

item.title: Flood waters reached the toes of this famous giant Buddha statue for the first time in decades
item.description: Floods in southern China have caused water from the Yangtze River to reach the toes of a famous gigantic statue of the Buddha -- reportedly for the first time in decades.

item.title: Top ex-Obama strategist: Let me just be really clear ...
item.description: David Axelrod, who advised former President Barack Obama, assesses the speech the former president delivered tonight at the Democratic National Convention.

item.title: Taiwan to ban Chinese streaming services
item.description: Taiwan is preparing to ban iQiyi and Tencent from operating streaming video services on the island, the latest in a series of moves by governments around the world against Chinese tech giants.

item.title: Dramatic new bodycam footage shows Sheriff's Deputy shoved Raptors' president during altercation
item.description: Dramatic new footage has emerged of the altercation between Toronto Raptors' president, Masai Ujiri, and a San Francisco Bay Area police officer, following the Canadian team's decisive game 6 victory in the NBA Finals last year.

item.title: Laos is a missing link in Asia's fight against organized crime
item.description: Synthetic drug production has exploded in Southeast Asia.

item.title: Google Maps has a new, more colorful look
item.description: Google Maps just unveiled its latest redesign. The new maps are more colorful and show more details so users can better understand what kind of terrain they're looking at.

item.title: Australia's Qantas says international flights 'unlikely' to resume before July 2021
item.description: Australian carrier Qantas Airways announced Thursday that it's "unlikely" to resume international flights before July 2021, as it suffers heavy losses due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: This company is taking on Africa's fake drinks industry
item.description: How do you know whether the product you are buying is the real deal and not an inferior or harmful knockoff?

item.title: Apple helped build 'top secret' iPod for US government, former engineer says
item.description: David Shayer was sitting at his desk in 2005 when his boss's boss at Apple asked him to take on a "special assignment" for the company: help the US Department of Energy build a "top secret" iPod.

item.title: Why the Mali coup could worry Trump and Macron
item.description: A coup in Mali, West Africa, could have ramifications far beyond its borders, threatening to further destabilize across the region and jeopardizing counter-insurgency efforts led by France and the United States.

item.title: US tells UK it will not seek death penalty for ISIS 'Beatles'
item.description: The Trump administration has informed the UK that it will not seek the death penalty for two of the high-profile ISIS members known as "the Beatles," in an effort to convince Britain to provide critical evidence that can be used to prosecute the operatives in US courts.

item.title: Lightning strikes lead to wildfires across two states
item.description: Nearly 11,000 lightning strikes have sparked 367 wildfires, with more than 300,000 acres burned across California, according to a Cal Fire spokesman. At least four blazes have already burned more than 150,000 acres in Colorado.

item.title: Trump endorsed a candidate who calls herself a 'proud Islamophobe'
item.description: If you've paid attention to the rise of the radical right on the internet over the last few years, you know the name Laura Loomer.

item.title: Archaeologists find rare artifacts under floorboards of English manor house
item.description: An archaeologist unexpectedly discovered medieval manuscripts, 16th-century clothing and Tudor books among the many artifacts left beneath the floorboards of Oxburgh Hall in Oxborough, England.

item.title: Tokyo's latest attraction: Transparent public toilets
item.description: One of Tokyo's most popular districts has recently added some unusual new attractions: transparent public toilets.

item.title: Series of Berlin highway crashes are 'suspected Islamist act,' say prosecutors
item.description: Police in Germany have arrested a 30-year-old man whom they say caused a series of motorway incidents in Berlin, in what prosecutors say is a "suspected Islamist act."

item.title: How a village grandmother became a YouTube sensation
item.description: It has become a common phenomenon in the digital age: undiscovered talent finds fame online. But this tech-centric, rags-to-riches story isn't quite the same, because Gangavva Milkuri is not your typical YouTube star.

item.title: Mouth breathing might be ruining your sleep. Here's how to fix it
item.description: Living with a plugged nose isn't fun, but James Nestor was ready. Plus, it was for science.

item.title: Putting your young children in timeout can work if done right
item.description: With parents spending more time with their children than usual due to the Covid-19 pandemic, their need for discipline that works is greater than ever. Fortunately, there are some proven techniques.

item.title: The odds of catching Covid-19 on an airplane are slimmer than you think, scientists say
item.description: Sitting squeezed between a number of strangers on board an aircraft might feel like a risky position during these uncertain times.

item.title: Police officer freed by firefighters after getting stuck in his own handcuffs
item.description: A British police officer needed to be rescued by firefighters after getting his hands stuck in a pair of handcuffs.

item.title: How Tokyo's massive lost & found works
item.description: The bad news—you lost your wallet in Tokyo. The good news—chances are good you will get it back, along with all the cash tucked inside. In Japan, residents are diligent about making sure what's lost is found and returned to its rightful owner. This is how the city's stunningly efficient Lost & Found system works.

item.title: The 13-year-old aiming to become Ferrari's first female Formula 1 driver
item.description: "My favorite part of racing is the speed."

item.title: Judged for what he wore: A first-time author writes about class and clothing
item.description: At student club nights in my first few weeks of university, more than once I was asked whether I had any drugs to sell. It's true that Oxford was -- and remains -- very White, but race didn't fully explain it. There were plenty of other young South Asian men. What made them so different to 18-year-old me? It slowly became clear that it was blazers, chinos, boat shoes and, yes, Oxford shirts.

item.title: Liverpool to face newly-promoted Leeds in first round of Premier League fixtures
item.description: Leeds United's long-awaited return to the English Premier League will begin with a trip to Anfield to face defending champion Liverpool.

item.title: SpaceX is now a $46 billion 'unicorn'
item.description: SpaceX, the Elon Musk-led company that recently became the first business in history to send astronauts into Earth's orbit, is parlaying its successes into big money.

item.title: Welcome to Aviation High School
item.description: At the Aviation Career and Technical High School, students literally have to earn their wings. Everyday, students take classes in an airplane hangar and work on real aircrafts. The New York City public high school has been training students since the 1930s, and it certifies the most airplane mechanics in the country. Advanced students spend their days at JFK Airport working on their own 727s. From the classroom to the sky, this school is pretty fly.

item.title: Blind musician can feel conductor's movements, thanks to high-tech baton
item.description: When Kyungho Jeon was young, he dreamed of playing in an orchestra, but his teachers feared it would be too difficult -- not because he lacked musical talent, but because he was born blind, and couldn't see a conductor's movements to follow their cues.

item.title: As Biden's running mate, she hopes to be a prosecutor who will take the fight to Trump 'for the people'
item.description: As Kamala Harris made history Wednesday night, she defined the role she hopes to play as Joe Biden's running mate: the defender of the voiceless, the vilified and the forgotten Americans who have struggled under four years of President Donald Trump.

item.title: Kamala Harris makes history and Obama issues warning
Hits and misses from Night 3 of the DNC
item.description: That's a wrap on Night 3 of the 2020 Democratic National Convention.

item.title: Biden joins Harris on stage following historic moment
item.description: During night three of the Democratic National Convention, presidential nominee Joe Biden joins running mate Kamala Harris on stage following her acceptance speech.

item.title: Obama issues a dire warning about US democracy
item.description: From the Philadelphia ground where the American experiment was born, one former president -- in a stunning prime-time address to the nation he once led -- warned that his successor was on the cusp of destroying democracy itself.

item.title: Seven takeaways from the convention's third night
item.description: The nation's most prominent Democrats on Wednesday night sought to instill a sense of urgency in voters that was absent four years ago, when Donald Trump was elected President.
